message: Is it possible to simply use the multiple DB's and tell each project to use the same DajngoAuth DB?
Or is it better to use a central CAS Server and something like django-cas http://code.google.com/p/django-cas/
Are there any thoughts about having a couple of Django projects use a single authentication service?

Django Docs:
Django doesn't currently provide any support for foreign key or many-to-many relationships spanning multiple databases. If you have used a router to partition models to different databases, any foreign key and many-to-many relationships defined by those models must be internal to a single database.
I suppose that means a CAS server then.
Am I missing something?  My initial reading of this says LDAP is perfect for this sort of thing, but nobody ever uses it cause it's not hip.  What are the differences between CAS and LDAP?
@bmelton comparison is with oauth: CAS doesn't train users to enter passwords on other sites, allows central session kill, etc. Also much easier to implement but less feature-rich
This might be what I'm looking for: https://github.com/zuber/django-cas-provider & https://github.com/Nitron/django-cas-consumer
